data.name: Preface
entries: This document is a compilation of all our house rules and rulings that have come up in play. If you think something should be added or changed please let me know. All my personal homebrew is allowed, clicking the following links adds each to your 5eTools:

items: {@note My homebrew revisions (Essential)} - {@loader Zuishin's Revised Collection [collection]|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ZuishinGit/homebrew/master/Collections/revisedCollection.json}
{@note My homebrew poisons (DMs only)} - {@loader Zuishin's Poisons [collection]|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ZuishinGit/homebrew/master/Collections/ZuishinsPoisons.json}
{@note Rules we use for crafting magic items} - {@loader Mundane and Magical Makings [book]|book/Weems; Mundane and Magical Makings.json}
{@note Magic item prices} - {@loader Sane Magic Item Prices Expanded [book]|book/Giddy; Sane Magic Item Prices Expanded.json}
{@note My encyclopedia magica (WIP)} - {@loader Encyclopedia Magica for 5e [collection]|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ZuishinGit/homebrew/master/WIP/Collections/encyclopediamagica.json}

entries.name: Point-buy
entries: 27 points; minimum 8; maximum 15 (this is standard point-buy)

entries.name: Rolling
entries: {@dice 4d6dl1}, with an optional mulligan of the entire array
{@note In the spirit of old-school D&D, I highly encourage rolling down-the-line to make your character feel more like a dynamic character and less like a static, preordained build.}

entries.name: Character Creation Options
entries: These are the options available to you for character creation: race, background, and classes. If you don't see something here, you have to check with me first.

items: All UA must be cleared with me beforehand (also I like to hear how your character's progress is going so feel free to clue me into {@b any} cool new abilities you get).

We have decoupled racial ASIs according to {@variantrule customizing your origin|tce|variant rules on customizing origin}. However, we generally do not adopt the proficiency customization offered by the same rule.
Upon creating a character, you are always permitted 1 feat of your choice.

entries.name: OMG, did you actually die? xD
entries: In addition to normal starting gear, you also get this:

rows: A single {@spell true strike} spell scroll.
Your choice of: 1 combat item worth up to 1,000 gold, 1 noncombat item worth up to 1,500 gold.
{@dice 1d4-2} consumables worth up to 120 gold each.
Your choice of: 1 combat item worth up to 2,000 gold, 1 noncombat item worth up to 2,500 gold.
{@dice 1d4-1} consumables worth up to 150 gold each.
Your choice of: up to 2 combat items whose total cost does not exceed 3,500 gold, up to 2 noncombat items whose total cost does not exceed 5,000 gold.
{@dice 1d4-1} consumables worth up to 200 gold each.
Your choice of: Your choice of: up to 2 combat items whose total cost does not exceed 8,000 gold, up to 2 noncombat items whose total cost does not exceed 9,500 gold.
{@dice 1d4} consumables worth up to 300 gold each.

entries.name: Race Options
entries: The race options are pretty strict. If something is not included it is usually less of a balance issue and more of a setting or compatability issue.

entries.name: PHB
entries: All PHB races are permitted.

entries.name: MTF Tieflings
entries: The tiefling subraces and {@race elf (sea)|mtf|sea elf} are permitted.

entries.name: VGM
entries: All VGM races are permitted.

entries.name: EEPC
entries: All EEPC races are permitted.

entries.name: ERLW
entries: The {@race shifter|erlw} race and its subraces are permitted.

entries.name: GGR
entries: The {@race loxodon|ggr} and {@race minotaur|ggr} are permitted.

entries.name: VRGR
entries: All VRGR races are permitted.

entries.name: MOT
entries: The {@race satyr|mot} and {@race leonin|mot} are permitted.

entries.name: Class Options
entries: I'm open to most classes. Ultimately, I don't care if something is imbalanced or not. I'm more concerned with party composition and whether or not class features play nice with existing rules.

entries.name: PHB
entries: All PHB classes are permitted.

entries.name: XGE
entries: All XGE classes are permitted.

entries.name: TCE
entries: All TCE subclasses are permitted. The {@class artificer|tce} class is {@u blacklisted}.

entries.name: EGW
entries: All EGW subclasses are {@u blacklisted}. Don't bother asking.

entries.name: Background Options
entries: All backgrounds are permitted, but in general they should adhere to the following structure:

items: 2 {@table skills|phb|skill} proficiencies, 1 {@table tools|phb|tool} proficiency, and a {@table standard languages|phb|language} proficiency.

entries: If none of the existing background options suit you, I encourage you to create your own or ask me and we can work together on making a setting-specific one. If you do this, use an existing background's starting equipment and non-essential feature as a template, and select the proficiencies you think would best fit the background.

entries.name: Feat Options
entries: All official feats are allowed.

entries.name: Gameplay Options
entries: Here is a list of options and variant rules that we've adopted that change the way the game is run:

entries.name: Additional Actions
entries: In addition to the normal {@5etools actions|actions.html} in official sources, you can also {@action climb onto a bigger creature|dmg}, {@action shove aside|dmg}, or {@action tumble|dmg} (as an action).

entries.name: Falling
entries: I incorporate {@variantrule falling|xge} rules from XGE as well as TCE's optional {@hazard falling onto a creature|tce} and {@hazard falling into water|tce} rules.

entries.name: Hitting Cover
entries: If a creature attacks a target that has cover and the AC provided by the cover makes the attack miss, then the attack hits the cover instead. Creatures providing cover can be hit, provided the attack roll is greater than said creature's AC.

entries.name: Lingering Injuries
entries: If you take a critical hit, you have the option to turn it into a normal hit and roll on the {@table lingering injuries} table. You can do this after seeing the initial damage roll. Doing this immediately awards you inspiration.
You can't do this more than once a session, or if you already are affected by a lingering injury.

entries.name: Mixing Potions
entries: If at any point you mix the contents of potions together, I'll roll on the {@table Variant: Mixing Potions; Potion Miscibility|dmg|potion miscibility} table. Mixing also includes drinking a potion while already under the effects of another potion.

entries.name: Skills with Different Abilities
entries: I will sometimes ask you to roll a skill check using a different ability score, according to the {@variantrule skills with different abilities|phb} variant rule. The most common of these is probably an Intelligence ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check to see how your knot-tying skills fare.

entries.name: Sleep Rules
entries: I like the idea that quality sleep is a luxury. As such, I incorporate all the {@variantrule sleep|xge|sleep variant rules} from Xanathar's guide.

entries.name: Tension Pool
entries: I use a tension pool for random encounters. It is a pool of {@dice d6}s. If I roll the pool and a resulting {@dice d6} has a 1 then something bad happens to you. Typically I add more die to the pool when you guys do boring shit. This includes stuff like ritual casting, short resting, bickering ooc, traveling slowly, or just whenever I feel like.

entries.name: Tools with Skills
entries: Sometimes if you have a proficiency with a skill and you have a tool proficiency that also applies to the check, I'll allow you to gain advantage. Alternatively, the use of your tool may warrant an additional benefit from succeeding on the check. In either case, it is {@b you} who has to mention your tool use, I will never ask you to roll using your tools. (These are RAW, according to {@variantrule Tool Proficiencies|xge|Xanathar's Guide to Everything})

entries.name: Rulings
entries: Here is a list of in-house rulings that have come up in play, that may contradict sage advice or RAW:

entries.name: 10-foot Pole
entries: Excessively unwieldy items such as the {@item pole (10-foot)|phb|10-foot pole} cause your speed to be reduced by 10 feet (as if {@variantrule Encumbrance|phb|encumbered}).

entries.name: Anti-dogpiling Rule
entries: Sometimes a skill check has no adverse effects for failure, in such a case it might seem appealing to let everyone attempt such a skill check which eventually will basically guarantee success on the check. To avoid this, sometimes (pretty rarely) I will limit who can attempt the check (based on background, proficiency, etc).

entries.name: Check Cooldown
entries: Generally if a skill check tests your capabilities but it feels like you can just reattempt it upon failing, I will rule that you can't actually reattempt it until some time has passed. Depending on how arduous the task is, the cooldown can range from a short rest to the next time you level up. Examples of checks like this include a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to bust a door down or an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to decipher a coded book. When you fail such a check, I will tell you when you can next reattempt it, so keep note.

entries.name: Holding Breath
entries: A character holding their breath must succeed a Constitution saving throw whenever they take damage, or have the wind knocked out of them. The DC equals 10 or half the damage taken, whichever is higher.

entries.name: Monster Multiattacks and Grappling
entries: A monster can replace its "biggest" attack in a multiattack action with a {@action shove|phb} or {@action grapple|phb}, in the same way a PC can replace one of their attacks when taking the attack action. The hope is that this will provide more interesting and engaging combat encounters.

entries.name: Movement through a Nonhostile Creature's Space
entries: By RAW moving through a nonhostile creature's space is difficult terrain; however, to facilitate smooth combat we ignore this ruling and treat movement as normal through such a space.

entries.name: Moving a Grappled Creature
entries: A creature that is grappling a target may use their own movement to reposition the {@condition grappled} target, following usual rules for movement. The target must remain in the grappler's reach the entire time.

entries.name: Potions in Combat
entries: Drinking a potion is a bonus action. Administering a potion to a willing creature is an action.

entries.name: Prone while Hovering
entries: Creatures that are hovering at least 5 feet off the ground (including PCs) are immune to the {@condition prone} condition.

entries.name: Silenced Condition
entries: This condition is used to cover the case that a creature might not be able to provide verbal components for the purposes of spellcasting. A creature is silenced if they are gagged, or if they run out of breath while suffocating.

entries.name: Unconscious Resting
entries: You can initiate a short rest while unconscious and at 0 hit points.

entries.name: Using Inspiration
entries: A player may use their inspiration to bend the rules in their favor a bit. It is ultimately up to me, but it doesn't hurt to ask.
